DataElement.preferredName: Behavior Assessment System for Children Parent Rating Scales Adaptive Skills Composite T-Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the T-score for the Adaptive Skills Composite that combines the adaptability, social skills, leadership, study skills, and functional communication scales from the Behavior Assessment System for Children, Parent Rating Form.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Behavior Assessment System for Children Parent Rating Scales Adaptive Skills Composite Score T-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of rating scales designed to facilitate the differential diagnosis and classification of a variety of emotional and behavioral disorders of children, aid in the design of treatment plans, and provide insight into an individual's thoughts and feelings._The Parent Rating Scales is used to measure both adaptive behavior and problem behavior in the community and home setting in individuals aged 2-21._A composite score of the Behavior Assessment System for Children that combines the adaptability, social skills, leadership, study skills, and functional communication scales. This composite score summarizes prosocial, organizational, study, and other adaptive skills._A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Behavior Assessment System for Children Parent Rating Scales
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of rating scales designed to facilitate the differential diagnosis and classification of a variety of emotional and behavioral disorders of children, aid in the design of treatment plans, and provide insight into an individual's thoughts and feelings.:The Parent Rating Scales is used to measure both adaptive behavior and problem behavior in the community and home setting in individuals aged 2-21.

Concepts.longName: Behavior Assessment System for Children, Second Edition
Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of rating scales designed to facilitate the differential diagnosis and classification of a variety of emotional and behavioral disorders of children, aid in the design of treatment plans, and provide insight into an individual's thoughts and feelings.
The Parent Rating Scales is used to measure both adaptive behavior and problem behavior in the community and home setting in individuals aged 2-21.

Property.preferredDefinition: A composite score of the Behavior Assessment System for Children that combines the adaptability, social skills, leadership, study skills, and functional communication scales. This composite score summarizes prosocial, organizational, study, and other adaptive skills.:A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

Concepts.definition: A composite score of the Behavior Assessment System for Children that combines the adaptability, social skills, leadership, study skills, and functional communication scales. This composite score summarizes prosocial, organizational, study, and other adaptive skills.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Versioned to remove edition reference. mc 4/28/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of an individual score into a standard form made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
